]]> No publisher eg205 Modern Languages 2015-03-13T17:00:00Z Event Nii Parkes reads from his work https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/english/news/events/nii-parkes-reads-from-his-work A Centre for New Writing event

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

Nii Ayikwei Parkes is a writer, editor, socio-cultural commentator and performance poet. He holds an MA in Creative Writing from Birkbeck (University of London) and is a 2007 recipient of Ghana's national ACRAG award for poetry and literary advocacy. Nii's d\ufffd\ufffdbut novel Tail of the Blue Bird was shortlisted for the 2010 Commonwealth Prize and his work has been translated into Italian, French, Chinese, Dutch, German and Arabic. His latest books of poetry are the Michael Marks Award-shortlisted pamphlet, ballast: a remix (2009) and The Makings of You (Peepal Tree Press).

]]> No publisher eg205 SPELL English English event 2015-03-16T17:00:00Z Event Ocho apellidos vascos https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/modern-languages/newsandevents/ocho-apellidos-vascos Film screening

Please join us on Monday 16th March, 6.15pm, in the Belvoir Park Lounge (second floor Charles Wilson Building), for a screening of Ocho apellidos vascos (Spanish film with English subtitles). This comedy was a box office hit in Spain in 2014!

All SML and Erasmus students are welcome.

]]> No publisher eg205 English English event SPELL 2015-03-18T17:15:00Z Event Jonathan Davidson on Publishing https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/english/news/events/jonathan-davidson-on-publishing A Centre for New Writing event

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

Jonathan Davidson is an author, poet, Chief Executive of Writing West Midlands, Director of Midland Creative Projects and joint founder and Associate Director of Birmingham Literature Festival. He will be speaking about the professional writing life, publishing, and working in the literature world.

This event is for creative writing students.

]]> No publisher eg205 Modern Languages 2015-03-26T16:30:00Z Event Postgraduate Forum https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/english/studentresources/societiesandcommittees/society-for-postgraduates-in-english-language-and-literature-spell-1/forthcoming-events-1/postgraduate-forum Papers from postgraduates in the School of English We will be holding the next Postgraduate Forum on Thursday\ufffd\ufffd26th March, 6pm, KE 322.

The Postgraduate Forum is held once every term, and is an excellent opportunity both to share your research with the rest of the English postgraduate community, and to hear about the fascinating topics others are working on. It's a great space to practice presenting your work to a listening audience, and to get feedback from a wide variety of perspectives.

We are looking for three twenty minute papers on any research topic within the School of English, or any 10 minute papers from MA students wishing to present their research or practice their dissertation presentations.

If you are interested in presenting a paper please send an abstract of under 200 words to\ufffd\ufffdFreya Brooks by Sunday 8th March, along with any questions you might have about the forum. We look forward to hearing about your research!

]]> No publisher fepb1 English event SPELL English 2015-03-26T18:00:00Z Event Book Launch: Hidden Stories https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/english/news/events/book-launch-hidden-stories A Centre for New Writing event

]]> No publisher eg205 English SPELL English event 2015-03-31T17:30:00Z Event Comics and Adaptation in the European Context https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/modern-languages/newsandevents/comics-and-adaptation-in-the-european-context One-day symposium

This one-day symposium aims to bring the fields of comics and adaptation studies into critical dialogue, and to provide an academic context for the discussion of adaptation from, and into, comics in the European context, including but not limited to France and Belgium, Italy, the United Kingdom, Germany, and the Iberian Peninsula. This symposium is organised primarily by Dr Armelle Blin-Rolland, a former colleague in the French department and now at the University of Bangor, Dr Catriona MacLeod (University of London, Institute in Paris) and Guillaume Lecomte (University of Glasgow), with support in the School of Modern Languages from Dr Marc Ripley.


Registration details and finalised programme to follow shortly.
